taskWriting1.thesis: The amount of money that a children's charity located in the USA spent and received in one year, 2016.
The Proportions of Pupils Attending Four Secondary School Types Between Between 2000 and 2009.
The city of Brandfield. City planners have decided to build a new shopping mall for the area, and two sites, S1 and S2 have been proposed.
The process that is used to manufacture bricks for the building industry
The components of GDP in the UK from 1992 to 2000.
The electricity generated in Germany and France from all sources and renewables in the year 2009.
British Emigration to selected destinations between 2004 and 2007.
Visits to and from the UK from 1979 to 1999, and the most popular countries visited by UK residents in 1999.
Thefts per thousand vehicles in four countries between 1990 and 1999.

taskWriting2.thesis: Some people think that the teenage years are the happiest times of most people's lives. Others think that adult life brings more happiness, in spite of greater responsibilities.
taskWriting2.task: Discuss both these views and give your own opinion.

taskWriting2.thesis: In many professional sports, there is an increase in the number of athletes using banned substances to improve their performance.
taskWriting2.task: What are the causes of the phenomenon and what are some of the possible solutions?

taskWriting2.thesis: Details of politicians’ private lives should not be published in newspapers.
taskWriting2.task: To what extent do you agree or disagree?

taskWriting2.thesis: Some people think that parents should teach their children how to be good members of society. Others, however, believe that school is the best place to learn this.
taskWriting2.task: Discuss both views and give your own opinion.

taskWriting2.thesis: TThe development of tourism contributed to English becoming the most prominent language in the world. Some people think this will lead to English becoming the only language to be spoken globally.
taskWriting2.task: What are the advantages and disadvantages to having one language in the world?

taskWriting2.thesis: Increasing the price of petrol is the best way to solve growing traffic and pollution problems.
taskWriting2.task: To what extent do you agree or disagree? What other measures do you think might be effective?

test.question: Chronobiology is the study of how living things have evolved over time.
Most animals are active during the daytime.
A 'night person' can still have a healthy circadian rhythm.
New therapies can permanently change circadian rhythms without causing harm.
What did researchers identify as the ideal time to wake up in the morning?
In order to lose weight, we should
Which is NOT mentioned as a way to improve supplement absorption?

answers.answer: avoiding drinks containing caffeine while taking supplements
taking supplements with foods that can dissolve them

test.question: The best time to stop drinking coffee is
In the evening, we should
Which of the following phrases best describes the main aim of the Reading Passage?

answers.answer: to suggest healthier ways of eating, sleeping and exercising
to describe how modern life has made chronobiology largely irrelevant
to introduce chronobiology and describe some practical applications

test.question: The speaker is assuming that laboratory workers

answers.answer: are unfamiliar with the Health and Safety Procedure
are fully aware of the Health and Safety Procedure
need to be reminded about the Health and Safety Procedure

test.question: All experiments

answers.answer: are at the discretion of the Health and Safety Officer.
only need to be referred to the Health and Safety Officer in special cases.

test.question: If projects are not approved by the Health and Safety Officer

answers.answer: an alternative project has to be undertaken.
the project may be reconsidered if required alterations are made to the project.
details of the project must be written down as a standard operating procedure.

test.question: It is not permissible to remove

answers.answer: samples and clothing from the laboratory.
contaminated objects, such as needles, from the laboratory.

test.question: Contaminated objects e.g. needles

answers.answer: need to be immediately removed from the laboratory.
are to be stored in special containers overnight.
need to be removed from the laboratory at the end of the working day.

test.question: Annette thinks the lecture will

answers.answer: coincide with a lecture on Computer Science.

test.question: Mark believes that microchip implant technology

answers.answer: is likely not to be well-received by most people.

test.question: In Mark's opinion, microchip implant technology

answers.answer: was not really predicted by science fiction.
has not yet left the realms of science fiction.
was fairly accurately predicted in science fiction.

test.question: Implanting a microchip is
Microchips are
